---
title: "Applying data wrangling to IGN Data"
output: html_notebook
---

1. Load original IGN data and necessary libraries
```{r load_data}
# Load libraries and read IGN CSV file

library("dplyr")
library("tidyr")
library("knitr")

IGN_data <- read.csv("ign_original.csv")
```

2. Check release year to be greater than 1995. If not, adjust records?
```{r check_release_year, results='hold'}
# Release year is supposed to be greater than 1995

IGN_data %>% distinct(release_year) %>% 
  arrange(release_year)

IGN_data[IGN_data$release_year == "1970", ]

IGN_data <- IGN_data %>% mutate(release_year = if_else(title == "The Walking Dead: The Game -- Episode 1: A New Day", as.integer(2012), release_year)) %>% 
  mutate(release_month = if_else(title == "The Walking Dead: The Game -- Episode 1: A New Day", as.integer(4), release_month)) %>% 
  mutate(release_day = if_else(title == "The Walking Dead: The Game -- Episode 1: A New Day", as.integer(24), release_day))



```

3. Group platforms into condensed platform list
```{r condense_platform_list}
# Release year is supposed to be greater than 1995

IGN_data %>% distinct(platform) %>% 
  arrange(platform)

IGN_data$platform_group <- if_else(grepl("Playstation", IGN_data$platform, ignore.case = TRUE), "Playstation", 
                                  if_else(grepl("Game Boy", IGN_data$platform, ignore.case = TRUE), "Game Boy",
                                         if_else(grepl("Nintendo", IGN_data$platform, ignore.case = TRUE), "Nintendo",
                                                if_else(grepl("Sega", IGN_data$platform, ignore.case = TRUE), "Sega",
                                                       if_else(grepl("Xbox", IGN_data$platform, ignore.case = TRUE), "Xbox", as.character(IGN_data$platform))))))

View(IGN_data)

IGN_data %>% distinct(platform_group)

unique(IGN_data$genre)
```
